messages.subject: Re: Fossil Hunting Girl
messages.msgSnippet: ... Good memory Becky!  Here you go: http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0688101968/qid%3D990882256/104-655819 8-0898344 Unfortunately it s out of print but
messages.messageBody:
on 5/25/01 2:11 PM, Beckyleach@... wrote:

> There's a semi-fictional version based on this girls' life, too....came out
> a few years ago to acclaim (and it was a great read) called *something*
> like.....__The Dragon in the Cliff__?

Good memory Becky! Here you go:

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0688101968/qid%3D990882256/104-655819
8-0898344

Unfortunately it's out of print but there's a "collectible" one for $68.40
at Amazon -- though I suspect libraries must have them for free.

(I wonder, will libraries start to see their collections disappearing so
people can sell them on ebay??? Or will libraries have to resort to
charging replacement fees for "lost" books rather than purchase price?)

Actually, just out of curiosity, I typed in Mary Anning at Amazon and turned
up a bunch of books about her. (There's also one called Dragon in the
Rocks.)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: Fossil Hunting Girl
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 05/25/2001 12:46:18 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:  _Stone Girl, Bone Girl_ about a turn of the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 05/25/2001 12:46:18 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< >> _Stone Girl, Bone Girl_ about a turn of the century
>> English girl who was a
>> noted fossil hunter as a child. (right level for
>> kids from 5-9, I would
>> say)
>>
>> Betsy
>>
>Dear Betsy.....I want to read this book. Who wrote it
>who is publisher? Do you have and address for a
>vendor? It isn't on the book club lists I have, or at
>the library.
>Sharon

I'm always nervous when I recommend something and someone buys it on my say
so. I hate to take money out of your pocket for something that you may or
may not like >>

There's a semi-fictional version based on this girls' life, too....came out
a few years ago to acclaim (and it was a great read) called *something*
like.....__The Dragon in the Cliff__?

Becky, who says "hi!" to those who already know her, and will introduce
herself to those who do not at some later, toothache-less date... ;-)

*** Becky***

"Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and
conscientious stupidity."

Martin Luther King Jr. (1929 - 1968), Strength to Love, 1963
